Posts.Content: Pnak wrote: I've been put on Cysplatin for triple negative (BRACA1) cancer.  I'm hoping to connect with other that are using or have used this chemo.  I just had the first round yesterday.  Thanks! Dx 1/2014, IDC, Stage IIA, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/28/2014 Mastectomy: Left, Right Chemotherapy 6/10/2014 AC + T (Taxol) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Cysplatin anyone? Pnak Pnak

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2014 07:52PM Pnak wrote: Curlyq,  I have also been nervous about the hair loss.  My doc told me that some people don't lose their hair on my chemo (Cisplatin).  I don't know.  I also have a new boyfriend of about 6 months (my husband passed from cancer 4 years ago).  I know that I'm just grateful to be able to be cured and feel a bit silly about worrying about my hair....but I know you ladies get it.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo January 6, 2014 desimone birdlover23

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2014 09:16PM Pnak wrote: I'm starting my chemo tomorrow, Jan 27.  I'm very nervous/scared.  It's like jumping into the unknown.  I'm glad to have this board to talk with others who understand!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo January 6, 2014 desimone birdlover23

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2014 09:28AM Pnak wrote: It was better than expected.  Well, thanks to Ativan.  lol  (thank you, Doctor).  One and done....3 to go (for this round anyway).  We can do it, ladies!!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo January 6, 2014 desimone birdlover23

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2014 11:39AM Pnak wrote: I found this wonderful place called The Healing Garden.  They provide free/low cost therapies to women with breast cancer.  So far, I've had massage and energy work (amazing!).  Tomorrow, I have yoga, support group, and acupuncture.  I feel this place is such a blessing...and it reminds me of one of my favorite quotes: "When it's dark enough, you can see the stars."  -Ralph Waldo Emerson and otceb, Thank you!
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo January 6, 2014 desimone birdlover23
